name: I have been detained by immigration officials.
text: I have been detained by immigration officials.

children.name: This is the first time I have been detained in the United States.
children.text: This is the first time I have been detained in the United States.

children.name: Do you qualify for any exemptions?
children.text: Do you qualify for any exemptions?

children.name: I do not qualify for one of the exemptions.
children.text: I do not qualify for one of the exemptions.

children.name: Immigration officials will collect a DNA sample from you. If you refuse, you may face criminal charges.
children.text: Immigration officials will collect a DNA sample from you. If you refuse, you may face criminal charges.

children.name: Your DNA sample will be sent to an FBI laboratory for analysis. The lab will use your DNA sample to create a DNA profile.
children.text: Your DNA sample will be sent to an FBI laboratory for analysis. The lab will use your DNA sample to create a DNA profile.

children.name: If the lab produces a DNA profile, it will be stored in a federal database.
children.text: If the lab produces a DNA profile, it will be stored in a federal database

children.name: If the lab cannot produce a DNA profile, immigration officials may try to collect another sample.
children.text: If the lab cannot produce a DNA profile, immigration officials may try to collect another sample.

children.name: If you are still in custody, they may collect another sample and send it to back to the lab.
children.text: If you are still in custody, they may collect another sample and send it to back to the lab.

children.name: If the lab produces a DNA profile, it will be stored in a federal database.
children.text: If the lab produces a DNA profile, it will be stored in a federal database.

children.name: If you are no longer in custody, immigration officials cannot require you to provide another DNA sample.
children.text: If you are no longer in custody, immigration officials cannot require you to provide another DNA sample.

children.name: If immigration officials request a DNA sample after releasing you from custody, you should seek the assistance of an immigration attorney.
children.text: If immigration officials request a DNA sample after releasing you from custody, you should seek the assistance of an immigration attorney.

children.name: I do not know if I qualify for one of the exemptions.
children.text: I do not know if I qualify for one of the exemptions.

children.name: You should contact a lawyer or legal aid organization as soon as possible. Resources.
children.text: You should contact a lawyer or legal aid organization as soon as possible.

children.name: I know I qualify for one of the exemptions.
children.text: I know I qualify for one of the exemptions.

children.name: If your exemption is accepted, you should not be required to provide a DNA sample. Resources.
children.text: If your exemption is accepted, you should not be required to provide a DNA sample.

children.name: I have previously been detained in the United States.
children.text: I have previously been detained in the United States.

children.name: While detained, I provided law enforcement a blood and/or saliva sample.
children.text: While detained, I provided law enforcement a blood and/or saliva sample.

children.name: Immigration officials will search a federal database and determine whether your profile is stored there.
children.text: Immigration officials will search a federal database to confirm that you have previously provided a DNA sample.

children.name: If your DNA profile has already been stored in CODIS, you may not be required to submit another sample.
While detained, I did not provide law enforcement a blood and/or saliva sample.
children.text: While detained, I did not provide law enforcement a blood and/or saliva sample.
